name: Cline (VSCode Extension)
description: Claude Dev extension for Visual Studio Code with MCP support
prerequisites: Install Visual Studio Code from https://code.visualstudio.com
Install Cline extension from VSCode marketplace
Search for 'Cline' or 'Claude Dev' by Saoud Rizwan
setupSteps: 4. Install the extension by Saoud Rizwan
13. Verify MCP server connection in Cline settings
testCommands: Open Cline and ask: 'Initialize the browser'
Ask: 'Get the page title and first paragraph'
Ask: 'Take a screenshot of the page'
Ask: 'Extract all links from the page'
Ask: 'Scrape any tables on the page'

verification.step3: Click the settings gear icon in Cline panel
verification.step5: Check if 'brave-real-browser' appears in the list
verification.step6: Status should show 'Connected' or green indicator
verification.step8: Test with: 'List all available browser automation tools'

extensionNotFound: Ensure you're searching in VSCode, not VSCodium
configFileNotFound: Open Cline panel at least once to create directories
serverNotConnecting: Check VSCode Output panel → Cline for logs
toolsNotWorking: Check if MCP server is enabled in Cline settings
View Cline logs in Output panel
permissionErrors: Clear npm cache: npm cache clean --force
jsonSyntaxError: Ensure all quotes are properly escaped
Use double quotes, not single quotes

autoApprove.description: Automatically approve specific tools without confirmation

disabled.note: Set to true to temporarily disable without removing config

env.description: Environment variables for the MCP server

performanceTips: Use autoApprove for frequently used safe tools
Keep Cline panel open during automation
Monitor Output panel (View → Output → Cline) for debugging
Use headless mode for faster execution
Close browser when done to free resources
bestPractices: Use environment variables for sensitive data
Use specific tool names in prompts

integrationTips.withWorkspace: Place config in workspace .vscode folder for project-specific settings
integrationTips.withGit: Add cline_mcp_settings.json to .gitignore if it contains sensitive paths
integrationTips.withTeam: Share configuration template without absolute paths
integrationTips.withCI: Can automate browser testing in CI/CD pipelines

notes: Cline extension required - not available in base VSCode
Works with all 110+ browser automation tools
Great for developers already using VSCode
Works on all platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux)
limitations: ⚠️ Need to restart VSCode after config changes

issue1.problem: Extension installed but Cline doesn't show

issue2.solution: Install MCP server first, then restart extension

issue3.solution: Use autoApprove for common tools to skip confirmation dialogs
